Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning to give the Mets a 3-2 lead.
Jesse Winker was hit by a pitch, stole second base, and scored on a Starling Marte double to extend the Mets' lead to 4-2.
David Peterson closed out the game by inducing a game-ending double play from Brice Turang.
Jake Bauers hit a pinch-hit home run in the seventh inning for the Brewers.
Sal Frelick followed with a home run on the next pitch to give the Brewers a 2-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Tobias Myers had an outstanding start for Milwaukee, allowing no runs and two hits over five innings with five strikeouts.
Jose Quintana pitched six scoreless innings for the Mets, allowing four hits with five strikeouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Winker was extremely pumped to score his run, spiking his batting helmet after crossing home plate.
The Mets advance to the NL division series to face the Philadelphia Phillies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Empire State Building was lit up in blue and orange to celebrate the Mets' playoff series win.
The Polish Sausage won the Sausage Race at American Family Field.
